alert.note: Alert for Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued October 10 at 9:45PM ChST until October 11 at 8:00PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: CORRECTED TO ADD COASTAL INUNDATION ...HIGH SURF WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CHST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously large breaking waves of 15 to 20 feet in the surf zone. Coastal inundation 5 to 7 feet. * WHERE...East, south and west facing reefs of Tinian and Saipan. * WHEN...Until 8 PM ChST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Life-threatening swimming conditions and significant beach erosion can be expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Dangerous surf is expected across the region the rest of tonight and Wednesday. Surf will increase along north facing reefs tonight and may become hazardous as Typhoon Bolaven moves further away to the northwest. This will also cause surf to decrease along east facing reefs.
info.instruction: Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure.
